TURN PROGRAM DIAL OR MINUTE HAND CLOCKWISE UNTIL

TURN MINUTE HAND CLOCKWISE UNTIL 10:30AM. IS ALIGNED

HAND WILL SHOW EXACTLY 10:30.
PROGRAMMING
THE WEEKLY PROGRAM DIAL REFLECTS THE SEVEN DAYS
OF THE WEEK AND AM / PM IMPRINTS FOR EACH DAY.
THE 24-HOUR DIAL HAS QUARTER - HOUR DIVISIONS AND
AM / PM INDICATIONS.
THE TIME SWITCH IS PROGRAMMED BY PUSHING THE

DAY DIAL. WHEN THE TRIPPER IS PUSHED TO THE INSIDE
THE SWITCH IS IN THE "OFF" POSITION.
HAND WILL SHOW EXACTLY 10:30.

TIME SETTING
TURN THE PROGRAM DIAL GRADUALLY CLOCKWISE UNTIL
THE DAY OF THE WEEK (7-DAY TIMER) AND TIME OF DAY
ON THE OUTER DIAL IS ALIGNED WITH THE TRIANGLE MARKER
ON THE INNER DIAL (TWO O'CLOCK POSITION.) FOR TO-THE-
MINUTE SETTING TURN THE MINUTE HAND CLOCKWISE TO
THE EXACT TIME OF DAY.
EXAMPLE FOR 7-DAY PROGRAM DIAL. MONDAY 10:30AM.
TURN PROGRAM DIAL OR MINUTE HAND CLOCKWISE UNTIL
MONDAY 10:30AM. IS ALIGNED WITH THE TRIANGLE ON THE INNER
DIAL. THE HOUR AND MINUTE HAND WILL SHOW EXACTLY 10:30.
EXAMPLE FOR 24-HOUR PROGRAM DIAL. MONDAY 10:30AM.
TURN MINUTE HAND CLOCKWISE UNTIL 10:30AM. IS ALIGNED
WITH TRIANGLE ON THE INNER DIAL. THE HOUR AND MINUTE
HAND WILL SHOW EXACTLY 10:30.
PROGRAMMING
THE WEEKLY PROGRAM DIAL REFLECTS THE SEVEN DAYS
OF THE WEEK AND AM / PM IMPRINTS FOR EACH DAY.
THE 24-HOUR DIAL HAS QUARTER - HOUR DIVISIONS AND
AM / PM INDICATIONS.
THE TIME SWITCH IS PROGRAMMED BY PUSHING THE
CAPTIVE TRIPPERS TO THE OUTER RING POSITION FOR THE
ENTIRE PERIOD THAT THE LOAD IS TO BE TURNED "ON" I.E.
FIFTEEN MINUTES FOR EACH TRIPPER ON THE TWENTY-FOUR
DIAL AND TWO HOURS FOR EACH TRIPPER ON THE SEVEN
DAY DIAL. WHEN THE TRIPPER IS PUSHED TO THE INSIDE
THE SWITCH IS IN THE "OFF" POSITION.
HAND WILL SHOW EXACTLY 10:30.
